member.name: T:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Base58
member.summary: A custom form of base58 is used to encode BitCoin addresses. Note that this is not the same base58 as used by Flickr, which you may see reference to around the internet.
member.remarks:
Satoshi says: why base-58 instead of standard base-64 encoding?
Don't want 0OIl characters that look the same in some fonts and could be used to create visually identical looking account numbers.
A string with non-alphanumeric characters is not as easily accepted as an account number.
E-mail usually won't line-break if there's no punctuation to break at.
Double clicking selects the whole number as one word if it's all alphanumeric.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Base58.DecodeChecked(System.String)
member.summary: Uses the checksum in the last 4 bytes of the decoded data to verify the rest are correct. The checksum is removed from the returned data.
member.exception: If the input is not base 58 or the checksum does not validate.

member.name: T:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair
member.summary: Represents an elliptic curve keypair that we own and can use for signing transactions. Currently, Bouncy Castle is used. In future this may become an interface with multiple implementations using different crypto libraries. The class also provides a static method that can verify a signature with just the public key.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates an entirely new keypair.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an ECKey given only the private key in a universlly friendly byte array form. This works because EC public keys are derivable from their private keys by doing a multiply with the generator value.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.GetPublicKeyBytesFromPrivateKeyBytes(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the raw public key bytes from private key bytes
member.param: The private key bytes to derive public key from
Force the public key to be compressed, default is true

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.pPublicKeyFromPrivate(Org.BouncyCastle.Math.BigInteger,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Derive the public key by doing a point multiply of G * priv.

member.name: P:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.PublicKey
member.summary: Gets the raw public key value. This appears in transaction scriptSigs. Note that this is not the same as the pubKeyHash/address.

member.name: P:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.IsCompressedPublicKey
member.summary: Gets the status of compression of the public key

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.Sign(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calculates an ECDSA signature in DER format for the given input hash. Note that the input is expected to be 32 bytes long.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.Verify(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the given ASN.1 encoded ECDSA signature against a hash using the public key.
member.param: Hash of the data to verify.
ASN.1 encoded signature.
The public key bytes to use.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.Verify(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Verifies the given ASN.1 encoded ECDSA signature against a hash using the public key.
member.param: Hash of the data to verify.
ASN.1 encoded signature.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.EcKeyPair.pGetPrivateKeyBytes
member.summary: Returns a 32 byte array containing the private key.

member.name: T:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Rfc2898_pbkdf2_hmacsha512
member.summary: Implementation of the Rfc2898 PBKDF2 specification located here http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2898.txt using HMACSHA512 but modified as opposed to PWDTKto match the BIP39 test vectors Using BouncyCastle for the HMAC-SHA512 instead of Microsoft implementation NOTE NOT IDENTICLE TO PWDTK (PWDTK is concatenating password and salt together before hashing the concatenated byte block, this is simply hashing the salt as what we are told to do in BIP39, yes the mnemonic sentence is provided as the hmac key) Created by thashiznets@yahoo.com.au v1.1.0.0 Bitcoin:1ETQjMkR1NNh4jwLuN5LxY7bbip39HC9PUPSV

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Rfc2898_pbkdf2_hmacsha512.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor to create Rfc2898_pbkdf2_hmacsha512 object ready to perform Rfc2898 PBKDF2 functionality
member.param: The Password to be hashed and is also the HMAC key
Salt to be concatenated with the password
Number of iterations to perform HMACSHA Hashing for PBKDF2

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Rfc2898_pbkdf2_hmacsha512.GetDerivedKeyBytes_PBKDF2_HMACSHA512(System.Int32)
member.summary: Derive Key Bytes using PBKDF2 specification listed in Rfc2898 and HMACSHA512 as the underlying PRF (Psuedo Random Function)
member.param: Length in Bytes of Derived Key

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Rfc2898_pbkdf2_hmacsha512.PBKDF2(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A static publicly exposed version of GetDerivedKeyBytes_PBKDF2_HMACSHA512 which matches the exact specification in Rfc2898 PBKDF2 using HMACSHA512
member.param: Password passed as a Byte Array
Salt passed as a Byte Array
Iterations to perform the underlying PRF over
Length of Bytes to return, an AES 256 key wold require 32 Bytes
member.returns: Derived Key in Byte Array form ready for use by chosen encryption function

where to start calculating checksum

member.summary: See .

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.DoubleDigest(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the SHA-256 hash of the given byte range, and then hashes the resulting hash again. This is standard procedure in BitCoin. The resulting hash is in big endian form.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.DoubleDigestTwoBuffers(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates SHA256(SHA256(byte range 1 + byte range 2)).

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.DecodeMpi(System.Byte[])
member.summary: MPI encoded numbers are produced by the OpenSSL BN_bn2mpi function. They consist of a 4 byte big endian length field, followed by the stated number of bytes representing the number in big endian format.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.HexStringToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hex based string into its bytes contained in a byte array
member.param: The hex encoded string
member.returns: the bytes derived from the hex encoded string

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.HmacSha512Digest(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calculates the 64 byte checksum in accordance with HMAC-SHA512
member.param: The bytes to derive the checksum from
Where to start calculating checksum in the input bytes
Length of buytes to use to calculate checksum
HMAC Key used to generate the checksum (note differing HMAC Keys provide unique checksums)

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.GetRandomBytes(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Safely get Crypto Random byte array at the size you desire.
member.param: Size of the crypto random byte array to build

Optional parameter to specify how many SHA512 passes occur over our seed before we use it. Higher value is greater security but uses more computational power. If random byte generation is taking too long try specifying values lower than the default of 5000. You can set 0 to turn off stretching
member.returns: A byte array of completely random bytes

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.Utilities.GetRandomBytesAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Safely get Crypto Random byte array at the size you desire, made this async version because can take 500ms to complete and so this allows non-blocking for the 500ms.
member.param: Size of the crypto random byte array to build

Optional parameter to specify how many SHA512 passes occur over our seed before we use it. Higher value is greater security but uses more computational power. If random byte generation is taking too long try specifying values lower than the default of 5000. You can set 0 to turn off stretching
member.returns: A byte array of completely random bytes

member.summary: Merges two byte arrays

member.returns: A byte array which contains source1 bytes followed by source2 bytes

member.name: T:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.VersionedChecksummedBytes
member.summary:
In BitCoin the following format is often used to represent some type of key:
[one version byte] [data bytes] [4 checksum bytes]
and the result is then Base58 encoded. This format is used for addresses, and private keys exported using the "dumpprivkey" command.

member.name: P:Bitcoin.BitcoinUtilities.VersionedChecksummedBytes.Version
member.summary: Returns the "version" or "header" byte: the first byte of the data. This is used to disambiguate what the contents apply to, for example, which network the key or address is valid on.

member.name: T:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39
member.summary: A .NET implementation of the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal - 39 (BIP39) BIP39 specification used as reference located here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039.mediawiki Made by thashiznets@yahoo.com.au v1.0.1.1 I â™¥ Bitcoin :) Bitcoin:1ETQjMkR1NNh4jwLuN5LxY7bMsHC9PUPSV

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.Language)
member.summary: Constructor to build a BIP39 object from scratch given an entropy size and an optional passphrase. Language is optional and will default to English
member.param: The size in bits of the entropy to be created
The optional passphrase. Please ensure NFKD Normalized, Empty string will be used if not provided as per spec
The optional language. If no language is provided English will be used

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.String,Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.Language)
member.summary: Constructor to build a BIP39 object using supplied entropy bytes eighter from a previously created BIP39 object or another method of entropy generation.
member.param: The entropy bytes which will determine the mnemonic sentence
The optional passphrase. Please ensure NFKD Normalized, Empty string will be used if not supplied as per spec
The optional language. If no language is provided English will be used

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.Language)
member.summary: Constructor to build a BIP39 object using a supplied Mnemonic sentence and passphrase. If you are not worried about saving the entropy bytes, or using custom words not in a wordlist, you should consider the static method to do this instead.
member.param: The mnemonic sentencs used to derive seed bytes, Please ensure NFKD Normalized
Optional passphrase used to protect seed bytes, defaults to empty
Optional language to use for wordlist, if not specified it will auto detect language and if it can't detect it will default to English

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.GetBIP39Async(System.Int32,System.String,Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.Language)
member.summary: An asynchronous static method to create a new BIP39 from random entropy. The random entropy creation is CPU intensive so is run in its own Task and we await as per async pattern.
member.param: The size in bits of the entropy to be created
The optional passphrase. Please ensure NFKD Normalized, Empty string will be used if not provided as per spec
The optional language. If no language is provided English will be used

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.AutoDetectLanguageOfWords(System.String[])
member.summary: Takes in a string[] of words and detects the language that has the highest number of matching words.
member.param: The words of which you wish to derive a language
member.returns: The best attempt at a guessed Language

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.GetSeedBytes(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Supply a mnemonic sentence with any words of your choosing not restricted to wordlists and be given seed bytes in return
member.param: The mnemonic sentence we will use to derive seed bytes, Please ensure NFKD Normalized
Optional passphrase to protect the seed bytes, Please ensure NFKD Normalized, defaults to empty string
member.returns: Seed bytes that can be used to create a root in BIP32

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.GetSeedBytesHexString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Supply a mnemonic sentence with any words of your choosing not restricted to wordlists and be given seed bytes hex encoded as a string in return
member.param: The mnemonic sentence we will use to derive seed bytes
Optional passphrase to protect the seed bytes, defaults to empty string
member.returns: Hex string encoded seed bytes that can be used to create a root in BIP32

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.pInit(System.String,Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.Language)
member.summary: Common initialisation code utilised by all the constructors. It gets all the bits and does a checksum etc. This is the main code to create a BIP39 object.

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.pGetMnemonicSentence
member.summary: Uses the Wordlist Index to create a scentence ow words provided by the wordlist of this objects language attribute

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.pGetWordIndeces(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Process entropy + CS into an index list of words to get from wordlist
member.returns: An index, each int is a line in the wiordlist for the language of choice

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.pRebuildWordIndexes(System.String[])
member.summary: Takes in the words of a mnemonic sentence and it rebuilds the word index, having the valid index allows us to hot swap between languages/word lists :)
member.param: a string array containing each word in the mnemonic sentence
member.returns: The word index that can be used to build the mnemonic sentence

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.pProcessBitsToInt(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Me encoding an integer between 0 and 2047 from 11 bits...
member.param: The bits to encode into an integer

member.name: M:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.pProcessIntToBitsThenBytes(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Takes the word index and decodes it from our 11 bit integer encoding back into raw bits including CS. Then it removes CS bits and turns back into entropy bytes
member.param: The word index to convert back to bits then bytes

member.name: P:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.EntropyBytes
member.summary: Gets the entropy bytes, they can be used to reconstruct this object, providing these bytes and passphrase is all that is needed

member.name: P:Bitcoin.BIP39.BIP39.Passphrase
member.summary: Sets the pasphrase, this lets us use the same entropy bits to derive many seeds based on different passphrases

member.summary: Gets the mnemonic sentence built from ent+cs
